meanings.definition: To strike or hit with or as if with a bat.
meanings.sent1: The cat batted at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: He batted the ball with the bat.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly batted its wings gently.
meanings.sent4: She batted her eyelashes to get his attention.
meanings.sent5: The child batted the pinata with excitement.

meanings.definition: To have a turn at bat in baseball.
meanings.sent1: In the game, each player batted three times.
meanings.sent2: He batted fourth in the lineup.
meanings.sent3: The team batted around the order in the last inning.
meanings.sent4: She batted last but scored the winning run.
meanings.sent5: The coach praised his batted performance at practice.

meanings.sent1: The bird batted its wings rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The flag batted in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The curtains batted softly in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly batted from flower to flower.
meanings.sent5: The kite batted in the sky gracefully.
